page.title: 06THE GUILDHALL, ABINGDON.
page.content: The Guildhall used to be the name of a group of buildings, that were once separate, but are now one building. They once belonged to the Abbey. The Guildhall was originally a Hospital called St.Johns it was a hall for sick people. The courtroom that joins the gateway is the Twelfth Century St.Johns Hospital. The Main Gateway was built in the l5th century. The Abbey Room that is over the gateway was the town jail from 1560 till 1812. The Courtroom has been used for this purpose since 1560. In 1563 the Roysse Room was used by John Roysse to refound Abingdon School. Until 1870 63 boys were educated there. The Abbey Hall was opened in 1966. The original Council Chamber is still used for this purpose. Written by Helen Costigan aged 10 years.
